instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
​
Hello everyone, I really hope some can tell me what to do or what could be the issue.
I have macbook air which I fixed after water damage for resale. I inspected board carefully and the only corrosion I found was in <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> area, 4.7ohm resister was bad. I replaced the resister and machine worked perfectly fine. I tested it, for hours, charged and discharged, after that put it up for sale.

In a week when we got customer for the laptop, it would not turn on. It didnt have green light or anything. Then I took it apart, and stated measure stuff to realize that I am getting green light again. I assemble it, and tested it again for 3 days running videos and stuff. So I put it back for sale.

In 2 weeks another customer was interested in the laptop. Guess what, the same thing. I couldn’t turn it on or get green light.
This time I unplug battery and put it back in. It started working again. How can I diagnose this when it randomly not working, or what could cause macbook to work temperary ? Btw it was 69% charged when it turned on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Corroded 821-1722 cable, corrosion inside that connector, corrosion in trackpad or trackpad connector, corrosion around <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, corrosion around <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>. What dos <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> measure from charger, with battery disconnected, when you have no green light?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: There were no corrosion in areas you describe.  I will let you know when it stops working next time.
